entry.title: elephant of Henry III (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the elephant of Henry III (pictured), which arrived in England in 1255, was the first to set foot in that country since the Roman invasion of Britain?

entry.title: Guns into Plowshares (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the sculpture Guns into Plowshares was built from 3,000 disabled handguns?

entry.title: Jozev Kiu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Hong Kongese wuxia author Jozev Kiu is an Eskrima coach and karateka?

entry.title: Vandal conquest of Roman Africa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Saint Augustine died during the Vandal conquest of Roman Africa?

entry.title: Samuel Hall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Samuel Hall established Salem's first newspaper, The Essex Gazette, in 1768, using it to support the colonial cause against British taxation?

entry.title: sthathicon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the heads of the Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church and Jacobite Syrian Christian Church certify their bishops by giving them a sthathicon?

entry.title: Lindsay Ring (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lindsay Ring regained control of his family catering firm and went on to become Lord Mayor of London?

entry.title: dark forest (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that some scientists believe we may live in a "dark forest"?
